div.p: Group 1 Mapping from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/Medication|5.0.0 to unspecified code system

tr.td: FHIR R5 Resource `Medication` is representable via FHIR R4 Resource `Medication`. Element `Medication` has is mapped to FHIR R4 element `Medication`, but has no comparisons.
Element `Medication.meta` has is mapped to FHIR R4 element `Medication.meta`, but has no comparisons.
Element `Medication.implicitRules` has is mapped to FHIR R4 element `Medication.implicitRules`, but has no comparisons.
Element `Medication.language` has is mapped to FHIR R4 element `Medication.language`, but has no comparisons.
Element `Medication.text` has is mapped to FHIR R4 element `Medication.text`, but has no comparisons.
Element `Medication.contained` has is mapped to FHIR R4 element `Medication.contained`, but has no comparisons.
Element `Medication.identifier` has is mapped to FHIR R4 element `Medication.identifier`, but has no comparisons.
Element `Medication.code` has is mapped to FHIR R4 element `Medication.code`, but has no comparisons.
Element `Medication.status` has is mapped to FHIR R4 element `Medication.status`, but has no comparisons.
Element `Medication.marketingAuthorizationHolder` has is mapped to FHIR R4 element `Medication.manufacturer`, but has no comparisons.
Element `Medication.doseForm` has is mapped to FHIR R4 element `Medication.form`, but has no comparisons.
Element `Medication.totalVolume` has is mapped to FHIR R4 element `Medication.amount`, but has no comparisons.
Element `Medication.ingredient` has is mapped to FHIR R4 element `Medication.ingredient`, but has no comparisons.

Element `Medication.ingredient.item` is part of an existing definition because parent element `Medication.ingredient` requires a cross-version extension. Note that the target element context `Medication.ingredient.item[x]` is a choice-type element and cannot directly hold extensions. The context is moved up to parent element `Medication.ingredient`. Element `Medication.ingredient.item` has is mapped to FHIR R4 element `Medication.ingredient.item[x]`, but has no comparisons. Note that the target element context `Medication.ingredient.item[x]` is a choice-type element and cannot directly hold extensions. The context is moved up to parent element `Medication.ingredient`.

Element `Medication.ingredient.isActive` is part of an existing definition because parent element `Medication.ingredient` requires a cross-version extension. Element `Medication.ingredient.isActive` has is mapped to FHIR R4 element `Medication.ingredient.isActive`, but has no comparisons.

Element `Medication.ingredient.strength[x]` is part of an existing definition because parent element `Medication.ingredient` requires a cross-version extension. Element `Medication.ingredient.strength[x]` has is mapped to FHIR R4 element `Medication.ingredient.strength`, but has no comparisons.
Element `Medication.batch` has is mapped to FHIR R4 element `Medication.batch`, but has no comparisons.

Element `Medication.batch.lotNumber` is part of an existing definition because parent element `Medication.batch` requires a cross-version extension. Element `Medication.batch.lotNumber` has is mapped to FHIR R4 element `Medication.batch.lotNumber`, but has no comparisons.

Element `Medication.batch.expirationDate` is part of an existing definition because parent element `Medication.batch` requires a cross-version extension. Element `Medication.batch.expirationDate` has is mapped to FHIR R4 element `Medication.batch.expirationDate`, but has no comparisons.

Note that there is an externally-defined extension that has been flagged as the representation of FHIR R5 element `Medication.definition` with an unmapped Reference type: `http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/alternate-reference`. Element `Medication.definition` has a context of Medication based on following the parent source element upwards and mapping to `Medication`.

title.value: Cross-version ConceptMap for FHIR R5 resources in FHIR R4

description.value: This ConceptMap represents the cross-version mapping of resource FHIR R5 for use in FHIR R4.
